shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 3r-143vb) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 3r-113r) I-2)Mäḫalǝyä nabiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 113v-124v) I-3) Mäḫalǝyä mäḫalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 124v-131r) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “The Praise of Mary” (fols. 132ra-140rb) I-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 140rb-143vb)
Additio 1.

txstates.txstate: Many leaves are worn, many are stained with dirt.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with dark brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the dark brown leather cover (at least 4 tools were used: double line fillet, double circle, interlaced line fillet, criss-cross).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of the endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire:
A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(12/fols. 3r-14v) – ፪II(12/fols. 15r-26v) – ፫III(10/fols. 27r-36v) – ፬IV(12/fols. 37r-48v) – ፭V(12/fols. 49r-60v) – ፮VI(12/fols. 61r-72v) – (፯)VII(12/fols. 73r-84v) – ፰VIII(10/fols. 85r-94v) – IX(12/fols. 95r-106v) – X(12/fols. 107r-118v) – XI(13; s.l.: 12, stub after 1/fols. 119r-131v) – XII(12/fols. 132r-143v) – B(2/fols. 144r-145v)
The number in quire VII has been erased. Quires IX-XII are not numbered. Bifolios in the middle of quires A and B have been cut short.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data are for fol. 4r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-4, I-5: all data are for fol. 133r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

abbreviations.abbreviation: እስ፡ for እስመ፡ ለዓለም፡ ምሕረቱ፡ (Ps. 135, fol. 104r-v) ስቡ፡ for ስቡሕኒ፡ አንተ፡ ወክቡር፡ አንተ፡ ለዓለም፡ (canticle 10, fol. 121r-v) Text I-4 ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain: ሠ፡/ሠረ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 132rb-va) እስ፡/እስመ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 133ra-134ra) ኵ፡/ኵሉ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 134ra-135rb) ናዓ፡ for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 136ra-137rb) ለኪ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ (fols. 137va-138ra) ተፈ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fols. 138va-139ra) ወበ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 139va-140ra) Text I-5 ወ፡ ሣ፡ ይ፡ ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ፡ for ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ይክፈለነ፡ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት The abbreviations stand for the whole refrain: ወበ፡/ወበእን፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 141ra-143rb).

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Ps. 1 is preceded by the following text: መዝሙረ፡ ዳዊት፡ ትመስል፡ ገነተ። ወታስተጋብእ፡ ኵሎ፡ ጽጌያተ። ትመልዕ፡ ፍሬያተ፡ ወታመጽዕ፡ በረከተ። ትሰድድ፡ አጋንንተ፤ ወታቀርብ፡ መላእክተ። - Traditional titles of the Psalms are missing.

additional.cont: Fols. 1v-2r: Mälkəˀa betä krəstiyan “Image of the Church”.
additional.det: The image is incomplete (apparently, only the beginning) and very crudely written. It is not registered in ChRep. The end part of the poem mentions Näʾakkwǝto Läʾab, ʾEfrem, Gäbrä Maryam and Lalibäla who are asked “to protect their sheep from the lion’s mouth”.

extras.extra: - The title of the work, ዳዊት፡, is written on a white piece of paper glued on the front cover. - The midpoint of the “Psalms of David” (in Ps. 77) is marked on fol. 60v with a sign ዝየ written in the inner margin. - The Pss. are divided into groups of ten separated by a line of alternating black and red dots or by an ornamental band. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the whole line or the end of the line: e.g., fols. 3r, 10r, 24v, 26r, 45r, 51v, 72v, 81r. - Part of the line is taken up: e.g., fols. 4v, 18r. - Part of the line is taken down: fol. 107r. - Tämälläs-sign, in the shape of two perpendicular lines, indicating the place where the omission, written in the upper margin, belongs: fol. 9v l.15. - Omitted letters, words, lines or passages written interlineally, in the main hand: e.g., fols. 4v, 8r, 19r, 46v, 54r, 74v, 75v, 80v, 131r. - Scribbles, doodles: fols. 1r, 2v, 36r, 88r, 124v, 138v, 143v, 144rv, 145rv.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Decorated quire marks are written in the left upper corner of fols. 15r, 27r, 37r, 49r, 61r, 85r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: Daily readings are indicated by the names of days of the week crudely written in the upper margin of fols. 23v, 23r, 46v, 64v, 87v, 88r, 91v, 92r, 101v, 102r, 113v, 114r.

drawing.info: Fol. 131v: The Virgin Mary with her Child.
drawing.details: Legend: ምስለ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ “With her child”.

frames.frame: - Fol. 3r (incipit of Text I-1): coloured (red, blue) ornamental band; floral and antropomorphic motifs. - Fol. 17r: coloured (red, blue, yellow, green) ornamental band; floral and geometric motifs. - Fol. 24r: coloured (red, yellow) ornamental band; floral and geometric motifs. - Fol. 33v: coloured (red, yellow) ornamental band; floral and geometric motifs. - Fol. 40v: coloured (red, yellow) ornamental band; floral and antropomorphic motifs. - Fol. 46r: coloured (red, yellow) ornamental band; floral motifs. - Fol. 54v: coloured (red, yellow) ornamental band; geometric and floral motifs. - Fol. 64r: coloured (red, yellow, black, white) ornamental band; floral motifs. - Fol. 71v: coloured (red, yellow) ornamental band; floral motifs. - Fol. 77r: coloured (red) ornamental band; floral motifs. - Fol. 88r: coloured (red) ornamental band; interlaces, zoomorphic, floral motifs. - Fol. 99r: uncoloured ornamental band; interlaces, zoomorphic, floral motifs. - Fol. 132r (incipit of Text I-4): coloured (red, yellow) ornamental band; interlaces, zoomorphic, floral motifs.
